result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deporation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Must complete an AODA assessment & comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
6 months upfront.
6 months banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
**Defendant to be released on 1/2/2017.  The outstanding/unserved jail time from 1/2/2017 going forward is to be added to the banked/stayed time for use by probation if necessary per Court's Order on 12/29/2016.**

records.addlTxt: from DOC to Judge Anderson requesting use of banked jail time - APPROVED 6/30/17
to Judge from DOC dated 6-2-17 re: conditional time

Defendant was not sentenced to jail time in this case (15CF264).  Defendant was only sentenced to jail in 15CF240.  The JOC will not be amended to reflect the modification to the jail sentence in this case.  The JOC in 15CF240 will be amended to reflect this change in the sentence.

CASES: 15CF264 & 15CF240. Defendant Adam J Reed in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NE-Clerk 10:36. Atty. Biller motion to amend JOC. ADA BR2 case/sent. - motion should be denied. Ct grants motion to amend - defer 6 months of jail to banked time balance. Ct to be begin 01-02-17. 10:46 adj. 2:23 back on - ADA not present, excused by Ct. Atty. Biller appears by telephone means WLC. Atty. Biller enters oral motion to include 15CF240. Ct grants motion to amend on both cases - motion now applies to both files. Ct defer 6 months of jail to banked time balance. Ct amended JOC to be completed on each file. 2:27 adj.
Bond paid to DOC for restitution

CASES: 15CF240 & 15CF264. Defendant Adam J Reed in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:00 pm.  

15CF264-Count 1-w/h, probation 2 yrs, concurrent.  $300 fine w/ costs for total $631, DNA sample, $200 surcharge.  No drugs.  AODA & compliance.

15CF240-Count 1-w/h, probation up to 3 yrs.  $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  1 yr CT, must sit 6 mo, 6 mo banked.  Subj to WR, no GT.  22 days credit if revoked.  No alcohol.  AODA & compliance.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Bond to be held for restitution.
Restitution request-exh 1, 30 days to obj to requested amount.  Hearing to be set.  PCR.  3:42 pm adj.  Review scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 07:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
